page.title: 01Overview
page.content: Our area is bisected by the A303, the trunk road that links London and the M3 with the West Country.To the north of this lies Bulford Camp and Bulford Village and to the south the ancient town of Amesbury. In between these two residential areas is an area of farmland primarily devoted to the growing of animal foodstuffs and wheat.It is on this farmland that the majority of ancient field systems and burial mounds are found. The north west corner of the area is crossed by the River Avon.The highest point Beacon Hill lies in the West.It is reputed to have been the sight of one of the Beacons announcing the coming of the Spanish Armada and was the sight of a Beacon on the night of the Royal Wedding in July 1981.There is little industry, the main employer being the Armed Forces and Naafi.
